page.title: 19PRIMARY SCHOOL-WALES VILLAGE
page.content: Wales Junior & Infant School is housed in three separate buildings, two of which are l09 years old. The third is twenty four years old. One building is for the infant children and has two classrooms. The infant age range is 4-7 years. The junior children are split between two buildings, with the first years alone in the building which also contains the hall. The older junior have classrooms in the 'new' building. We now have just six classes altogether; two infant & four junior. There are l54 children in the school, making an average of about 25 in each class. There are six teachers, the headmaster,the secretary, a non- teaching assistant, a cleaner & a caretaker who has been here for 27 years and is retiring at the end of this school year.
